markdownRemark.html: Everyone who has spent some time working with git irremediably knows about merging. The merge command brings the changes carried out in a B branch (new-feature) to the main branch A (master). It does work fine when the A branch is not being modified. If no conflicts arise, new changes are added on top the A branch. The log reflects an incremental order of commits, or put in other words, the commits are shown in the same order were added. A timeline of changes.
